page.title: 06NEW DEVELOPMENT IN RHU
page.content: As we live in a Conservation area,strict planning regulations have to be met to ensure that the new blends in discretely with the old.While some remain family homes,the trend for the '80's is for the sub_division of mansions into luxury flats and the gardens split and sold as building plots.Thus,new development tends to consist of detached houses, predominantly of timber_frame construction,interspersed amongst the old houses on the fringes of the village.An exception to this is the new Broseley estate which includes terraced houses and flats built by traditional methods on the site of a former orchard in the village centre. Also in great demand are former lodge houses and stable blocks for renovation and conversion into homes.
